tool_description: Models the impact of weather conditions on electricity demand and renewable generation using historical correlations and machine learning.

historical_correlation_period.description: Historical period in days for correlation analysis (30 to 1095)

weather_variables.description: Weather variables to model: temperature, humidity, wind_speed, solar_irradiance

model_type.description: Modeling approach: linear, polynomial, or machine_learning

heating_cooling_thresholds.description: Heating and cooling degree day thresholds [heating_temp, cooling_temp]

error_messages: Invalid correlation period: Must be between 30 and 1095 days.
Invalid weather variables: Use temperature, humidity, wind_speed, or solar_irradiance.
Invalid model type: Use linear, polynomial, or machine_learning.
Invalid sensitivity factor: Must be between 0.1 and 5.0.
Insufficient weather data: Need at least 24 hours of weather data for modeling.
Invalid temperature thresholds: Heating threshold must be less than cooling threshold.
usage: Provide weather_data array, historical_correlation_period, and weather_variables. Optionally set model_type, demand_sensitivity, and heating_cooling_thresholds. Returns weather impact adjustments for demand and generation.

demand_adjustment_mw.description: Demand adjustments in MW due to weather
